transportAdvice: Berlin has an extensive public transit network including metro (U-Bahn), suburban rail (S-Bahn), trams, and buses that reliably cover tourist areas and outer districts. The city centre is walkable between many major sights, and taxis are widely available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and grey with occasional snow or frost; pack warm layers and expect short daylight hours.
Still cold and wintry with limited sunshine, though days begin to lengthen slightly.
Early spring brings cool but improving conditions with occasional sunny spells and fresh breezes.
Mild and pleasant with blooming parks; light rain showers are common so a jacket is advisable.
Warm and increasingly sunny; one of the best months to visit with outdoor terraces coming to life.
Warm summer weather with long evenings; occasional thunderstorms can bring brief heavy rain.
The warmest month with long sunny days; thunderstorms are possible but generally very enjoyable.
Hot and sunny with similar conditions to July; outdoor events and festivals are in full swing.
Early autumn brings comfortable temperatures and fewer crowds; a great time to explore the city.
Noticeably cooler with autumn foliage; rain becomes more frequent and evenings turn chilly.
Cold, damp, and often overcast; one of the least appealing months weather-wise but quieter for tourism.
Cold and dark with festive Christmas markets providing a lively atmosphere despite the chill.
